arguments.value: esrefactor.Context only accepts a syntax tree with range information

trailingComments.value: Given the scope, look up the reference which corresponds to the identifier
in the specified cursor position. If possible, find also the corresponding

leadingComments.value: Given the scope, look up the reference which corresponds to the identifier

trailingComments.value: Given the cursor position, locate the identifier in that position.
If there is no identifier in that position, undefined will be returned.
The returned object will have the following property:
identifier: the syntax node associated with the identifier
declaration: the syntax node where the identifier is declared
references: an array of the references of the identifier
Note that the references array also includes the identifier but it
var ctx = new esrefactor.Context('var x; x; x = 42');
id will have the value of:

arguments.value: Unable to identify anything without a syntax tree
arguments.raw: 'Unable to identify anything without a syntax tree'

arguments.value: Unable to identify anything without a valid scope manager
arguments.raw: 'Unable to identify anything without a valid scope manager'

leadingComments.value: Search for all other identical references (same scope).
Given the cursor position, locate the identifier in that position.
If there is no identifier in that position, undefined will be returned.
The returned object will have the following property:
identifier: the syntax node associated with the identifier
declaration: the syntax node where the identifier is declared
references: an array of the references of the identifier
Note that the references array also includes the identifier but it
var ctx = new esrefactor.Context('var x; x; x = 42');
id will have the value of:

trailingComments.value: Rename the identifier and its reference to a new specific name.
The return value is the new code after the identifier is renamed.
This functions needs identification, which is obtain using identify() function.
var ctx = new esrefactor.Context('var x; x = 42');

arguments.value: Unable to rename without the original source

trailingComments.value: Prevent double renaming, get the unique set.

Given the cursor position, locate the identifier in that position.

identifier: the syntax node associated with the identifier
declaration: the syntax node where the identifier is declared
references: an array of the references of the identifier
Note that the references array also includes the identifier but it
var ctx = new esrefactor.Context('var x; x; x = 42');
